original: 'khor de na dge slong ma 'khod pa rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' mi mchog sa bcu thob pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: 'khor de na dge slong ma 'khod pa rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' mi mchog sa bcu thob pa sha stag ste /
translated: In that assembly, the bhikṣuṇīs were all bodhisattvas who had attained the tenth bhūmi, the bhūmi of the highest bodhisattvas.

original: gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir bud med kyi gzugs dang / bud med kyi dbyibs dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa mang po dang / rus pa'i lus 'chang ba rtag tu tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir bud med kyi gzugs dang / bud med kyi dbyibs dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa mang po dang / rus pa'i lus 'chang ba rtag tu tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa dang ldan pa /
translated: For the sake of guiding beings, they had taken on the form of women, the shape of women, and the bodies of women with much flesh, blood, sinew, and bone, and they were always endowed with the practice of the four immeasurables.

original: bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi cho 'phrul chen po'i don byed nus pa sha stag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi cho 'phrul chen po'i don byed nus pa sha stag go //
translated: They were all able to perform the great miracles of the Buddha’s domain.

original: gzhan yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtshos byin la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed thams cad kyang mi mchog sa bcu thob pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtshos byin la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed thams cad kyang mi mchog sa bcu thob pa /
translated: “ Moreover, at that time there were bodhisattvas such as Sāgara­datta, and bodhisattvas as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River. They had all attained the tenth bhūmi of a supreme human.

original: thabs kyis lus 'chang ba sha stag la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thabs kyis lus 'chang ba sha stag la 'di lta ste /
translated: They were all bodhisattvas who had taken on bodies through skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgya mtshos byin dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros mi zad pa dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyang theg pa chen po thos par 'dod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgya mtshos byin dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros mi zad pa dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyang theg pa chen po thos par 'dod pa /
translated: They were the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sāgara­datta, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati, and so forth. All of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas desired to hear the Mahāyāna.

original: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa /🔽theg pa chen pos bkres pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa / theg pa chen pos bkres pa /
translated: They had entered the Mahāyāna.🔽They were hungry for the Mahāyāna.

original: theg pa chen po la sred pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la sred pa /
translated: They craved the Mahāyāna.

original: theg pa chen po la ser sna med pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ser sna med pa /
translated: They were not stingy with the Mahāyāna.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang mthun par byed nus pa sha stag dang / bdag cag rgal nas gzhan bsgral bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang mthun par byed nus pa sha stag dang / bdag cag rgal nas gzhan bsgral bar bya'o //
translated: They are all able to act in accordance with the whole world, and they think, “Having crossed over ourselves, we will help others to cross over.”🔽They practice the conduct of upholding the vows of the array of discipline that they have properly taken up for many millions of eons in the past.

original: snyam ste sngon gyi bskal pa bye ba @5b snyed du tshul khrims kyi bkod pa'i dam bca' ba legs par blangs pa 'dzin pa'i spyad pa spyod pa sha stag dang / de bzhin du bdag cag grol nas gzhan dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: snyam ste sngon gyi bskal pa bye ba @5b snyed du tshul khrims kyi bkod pa'i dam bca' ba legs par blangs pa 'dzin pa'i spyad pa spyod pa sha stag dang / de bzhin du bdag cag grol nas gzhan dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, they think, “Having been liberated ourselves, we will liberate others.”

original: snyam pa dang / de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum gyis gdung mi 'chad par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam pa dang / de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum gyis gdung mi 'chad par bya'o //
translated: They think, “We will not let the lineage of the Three Jewels be broken.”

original: snyam pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: snyam pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o //
translated: They think, “We will turn the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: snyam pa dang / go cha chen po bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: snyam pa dang / go cha chen po bgo bar bya'o //
translated: They think, “We will don the great armor.”

original: snyam du sems pa sha stag dang / de bzhin du yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa dang / bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la snyoms par lta ba sha stag ste /
analyzed: snyam du sems pa sha stag dang / de bzhin du yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa dang / bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la snyoms par lta ba sha stag ste /
translated: They are endowed with immeasurable good qualities, and they regard all sentient beings equally, as if they were their only child.

original: de dag thams cad snga dro'i nyi ma 'char kar yan lag thams cad kyi ba spu rgya skyegs kyi shing gi me tog ltar rtsa dmar ba ni /🔽langs / mig ni /
analyzed: de dag thams cad snga dro'i nyi ma 'char kar yan lag thams cad kyi ba spu rgya skyegs kyi shing gi me tog ltar rtsa dmar ba ni / langs / mig ni /
translated: At sunrise, all of their body hairs stood on end, like the red flowers of the dhautaka tree.

original: mchi ma khrag lta bus gang ste /
analyzed: mchi ma khrag lta bus gang ste /
translated: Their eyes filled with tears like blood.

original: mchog tu sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba dang ldan nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba'i phyir dang / gdul bar bya ba'i dbang gi don du theg pa chen po'i mchog tu gsang ba /
analyzed: mchog tu sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba dang ldan nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba'i phyir dang / gdul bar bya ba'i dbang gi don du theg pa chen po'i mchog tu gsang ba /
translated: Enduring the most painful of feelings, they went to where the Blessed One was, in order to benefit, bring happiness, and show compassion to all sentient beings, and for the sake of those to be trained.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dgongs pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo'i tshul bshad par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dgongs pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo'i tshul bshad par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: In order to explain the supreme secret of the Great Vehicle, the aspect of emptiness, the method of the various kinds of intentional expressions, they approached the Blessed One and, having arrived, bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan 'bum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan 'bum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: They circumambulated the Bhagavat one hundred thousand times and, bowing with palms joined, they sat to one side.

original: yang de'i tshe bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs shing /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs shing /
translated: At that time, there were upāsakas who had taken the five precepts,

original: @6a *// tshul khrims dang / cho ga dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i dge bsnyen 'od dri ma med par grags pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa dge bsnyen gang'ga'i klung gnyis kyi bye ma snyed thams cad kyang zung dang zung du shes par 'dod pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: @6a *// tshul khrims dang / cho ga dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i dge bsnyen 'od dri ma med par grags pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa dge bsnyen gang'ga'i klung gnyis kyi bye ma snyed thams cad kyang zung dang zung du shes par 'dod pa sha stag ste /
translated: and there were upāsakas who were pure in their conduct, discipline, and qualities, such as the upāsaka King Vimalakīrtirāja. There were as many of them as there are grains of sand in two Gaṅgā rivers, and all of them were known as pairs.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / stong pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na dang / de kho na ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / stong pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na dang / de kho na ma yin pa dang /
translated: They were in agreement about suffering and happiness, permanence and impermanence, self and no-self, emptiness and non-emptiness, reality and unreality,

original: skyabs dang / skyabs ma yin pa dang / sems can dang / sems can med pa dang / brtan pa dang / brtan pa ma yin pa dang / zhi ba dang / zhi ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
analyzed: skyabs dang / skyabs ma yin pa dang / sems can dang / sems can med pa dang / brtan pa dang / brtan pa ma yin pa dang / zhi ba dang / zhi ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
translated: refuge and non-refuge, sentient beings and non-sentient beings, stable and unstable, peaceful and not peaceful, compounded and uncompounded,🔽permanent and impermanent, completely liberated and not completely liberated, and so forth.

original: ther zug dang / ther zug ma yin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / khyad par du 'phags pa shes par 'dod pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: ther zug dang / ther zug ma yin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / khyad par du 'phags pa shes par 'dod pa sha stag ste /
translated: They all wished to know the distinctions and what is superior.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were as follows:

original: dge bsnyen 'od dri ma med par grags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen rab sbyin la sogs pa dge bsnyen theg pa chen po thos par 'dod la thos nas kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen 'od dri ma med par grags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen rab sbyin la sogs pa dge bsnyen theg pa chen po thos par 'dod la thos nas kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
translated: The lay practitioner known as King of Stainless Radiance, the lay practitioner Supreme Generosity, and other lay practitioners who desired to hear the Mahāyāna and, having heard it, thought, “I will teach it to others.”

original: snyam du dam bcas shing tshul khrims blangs pa /
analyzed: snyam du dam bcas shing tshul khrims blangs pa /
translated: They had taken up the discipline with that commitment.

original: theg pa chen pos skom la ngoms nas kyang gzhan skom pa dag ngom par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos skom la ngoms nas kyang gzhan skom pa dag ngom par bya'o //
translated: Having been satisfied by the Great Vehicle, they will satisfy others.

original: snyam du dam bcas pa /🔽theg pa chen po la sred pa /
analyzed: snyam du dam bcas pa / theg pa chen po la sred pa /
translated: They have made this promise.🔽They are devoted to the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po la ser sna med pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ser sna med pa /
translated: They are not stingy with the Great Vehicle.🔽They are able to act in harmony with all worlds.

original: 'jig @6b rten thams cad dang mthun par byed nus pa sha stag dang / bdag cag rgal nas gzhan bsgral bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig @6b rten thams cad dang mthun par byed nus pa sha stag dang / bdag cag rgal nas gzhan bsgral bar bya'o //
translated: They think, “Having crossed over, we will help others to cross over.

original: bdag cag grol nas gzhan dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag grol nas gzhan dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Having gained freedom, we will help others to gain freedom.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par bya'o //
translated: We will not let the lineage of the Three Jewels be broken.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o //
translated: We will turn the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: snyam du slob par 'dod pa /
analyzed: snyam du slob par 'dod pa /
translated: They wish to train in this way.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: They are clad in the great armor.🔽They are respectful toward the trainings.

original: bslab pa rnams la sems gus pa dang / de bzhin du yon tan grangs med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams la sems gus pa dang / de bzhin du yon tan grangs med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They have countless other qualities.

original: bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan pa sha stag ste /
translated: They are compassionate toward all sentient beings, as if they were their only child.

original: de dag kyang nyi ma 'char kar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i phyir re res kyang tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / thang shing gi mchog dang / tsandan sa mchog pa'i bud shing rnams dang / yam bsreg shing dri bsung dang ldan pa yon tan can lnga stong lnga stong khyer te 'ongs so; ;de la yam bsreg shing sna re zhing yang gser gyi skud pa rin po che sna bdun rigs bdun dang ldan pas spras pas dkris pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang nyi ma 'char kar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i phyir re res kyang tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / thang shing gi mchog dang / tsandan sa mchog pa'i bud shing rnams dang / yam bsreg shing dri bsung dang ldan pa yon tan can lnga stong lnga stong khyer te 'ongs so; ;de la yam bsreg shing sna re zhing yang gser gyi skud pa rin po che sna bdun rigs bdun dang ldan pas spras pas dkris pa /
translated: Each stick was wrapped in golden thread adorned with the seven precious substances and the seven types of jewels.

original: ri mo la bris pa kho na bzhin du 'dug pa /
analyzed: ri mo la bris pa kho na bzhin du 'dug pa /
translated: They were as beautiful as if they were painted in a picture.

original: rang bzhin gyis gzhon sha can legs par bcos pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gzhon sha can legs par bcos pa sha stag ste /
translated: They were all fresh and well-prepared by nature.

original: sna re zhing yang 'od rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i phung po chen po //🔽mdog sngo ba dang / bar bar kha cig tu mdog dkar /
analyzed: sna re zhing yang 'od rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i phung po chen po // mdog sngo ba dang / bar bar kha cig tu mdog dkar /
translated: Each stick had a great mass of various colors,🔽some blue, some white,

original: kha cig tu sngo skya /
analyzed: kha cig tu sngo skya /
translated: some light blue,

original: kha cig tu rtsa dmar /
analyzed: kha cig tu rtsa dmar /
translated: some red,🔽and some yellow.

original: kha cig tu ser pa mig tu sdug par byas pa sha stag go /
analyzed: kha cig tu ser pa mig tu sdug par byas pa sha stag go /
translated: In some places, the yellow ones were made beautiful by the eyes.

original: bam po re re'i g-yogs ma'i phyar bu'ang rin po che sna bdun las byas pa sha stag go //🔽chings ma'i the @7a *//
analyzed: bam po re re'i g-yogs ma'i phyar bu'ang rin po che sna bdun las byas pa sha stag go // chings ma'i the @7a *//
translated: The covers of each volume were made of the seven precious substances.🔽The many strings of the binding

original: gu mang po re re zhing yang ldong ros kyi mdog lta bu dang / zar ma'i me tog gi mdog lta bu dang / sngon po dang / ser po rnams kyis bar bar du spel ba sha stag go /
analyzed: gu mang po re re zhing yang ldong ros kyi mdog lta bu dang / zar ma'i me tog gi mdog lta bu dang / sngon po dang / ser po rnams kyis bar bar du spel ba sha stag go /
translated: were interspersed with the colors of minium, jasmine flowers, blue, and yellow.

original: de la chings ma'i the gu mang po re re zhing yang gser thags kyi mchog rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: de la chings ma'i the gu mang po re re zhing yang gser thags kyi mchog rnam par dag pa /
translated: Each of the many strings of the binding was made of the finest golden thread,

original: yul mang por grags pa dag gis spel ba sha stag go /
analyzed: yul mang por grags pa dag gis spel ba sha stag go /
translated: which was interspersed with many famous places.

original: de la yam bsreg shing sna re zhing yang spos dri bsung zhim po dang / me tog phreng dang / gur gum gyi phye ma dang ldan par byas pa /
analyzed: de la yam bsreg shing sna re zhing yang spos dri bsung zhim po dang / me tog phreng dang / gur gum gyi phye ma dang ldan par byas pa /
translated: Each of the sticks of incense was made of fragrant incense, flower garlands, and saffron powder.

original: gser thags kyis g-yogs pa dar snas brgyan pa rin po che sna bdun gyi shubs sngon po dang / ser po dang / sngo skya dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka lta bu dag gi nang du bcug pa /
analyzed: gser thags kyis g-yogs pa dar snas brgyan pa rin po che sna bdun gyi shubs sngon po dang / ser po dang / sngo skya dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka lta bu dag gi nang du bcug pa /
translated: They were covered with golden thread, adorned with various silks, and wrapped in blue, yellow, light blue, white, and reddish-brown cases made of the seven precious substances.

original: yul ka li dka'i ras dang / zar ma'i ras dang / zab dar dang / rgya dar gyi mchog rnams kyis dkris pa /
analyzed: yul ka li dka'i ras dang / zar ma'i ras dang / zab dar dang / rgya dar gyi mchog rnams kyis dkris pa /
translated: They were wrapped in the finest fabrics from Kaliṅga, China, Persia, and India.

original: me tog mang pos brgyan pa /
analyzed: me tog mang pos brgyan pa /
translated: They were adorned with many flowers.

original: byug pa dri bsung zhim po dag gis byugs pa sha stag go /
analyzed: byug pa dri bsung zhim po dag gis byugs pa sha stag go /
translated: They were anointed with fragrant ointments.

original: yam bsreg shing sna re'i shing rta re re zhing yang rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa gser gyis mdzes par byas pa kha cig /
analyzed: yam bsreg shing sna re'i shing rta re re zhing yang rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa gser gyis mdzes par byas pa kha cig /
translated: Each of the carts for the firewood was adorned with the seven precious substances, beautified with gold,

original: kha cig tu sngon po dang / dkar po dang / bab la'i kha dog dang / li khri'i kha dog pas lhag pa'i 'od gsal ba dang ldan pa sha stag go /
analyzed: kha cig tu sngon po dang / dkar po dang / bab la'i kha dog dang / li khri'i kha dog pas lhag pa'i 'od gsal ba dang ldan pa sha stag go /
translated: and some were made of blue, white, red, and orange precious substances.

original: shing rta de dag gi gnya' shing rnams kyang rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: shing rta de dag gi gnya' shing rnams kyang rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa /
translated: The yokes of the carts were also adorned with the seven precious substances.

original: dpe med pa /
analyzed: dpe med pa /
translated: They are all incomparable,

original: rta cang shes mgyogs pa dag dang sbyar ba sha stag go /
analyzed: rta cang shes mgyogs pa dag dang sbyar ba sha stag go /
translated: and are like the speed of a well-trained horse.

original: rta de dag kyang rlung gi shugs pas mgyogs pa /
analyzed: rta de dag kyang rlung gi shugs pas mgyogs pa /
translated: Those horses are as fast as the wind,

original: spu kha chu skyar @7b gyi mdog dang / ldong ros kyi mdog dang / sprin gyi mdog can sha stag ste /
analyzed: spu kha chu skyar @7b gyi mdog dang / ldong ros kyi mdog dang / sprin gyi mdog can sha stag ste /
translated: and their fur is the color of a crane, the color of vermilion, and the color of a cloud.

original: thabs de 'dra ba'i shing rta re re'i mdun logs dang / rgyab logs su rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgreng ste /
analyzed: thabs de 'dra ba'i shing rta re re'i mdun logs dang / rgyab logs su rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgreng ste /
translated: In front of and behind each of those chariots, they raise up victory banners and flags.

original: rgyal mtshan thams cad kyang rin po che las byas pa /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan thams cad kyang rin po che las byas pa /
translated: All the victory banners are made of jewels,

original: gser gyi dra bas g-yogs pa sha stag go /
analyzed: gser gyi dra bas g-yogs pa sha stag go /
translated: and are covered with golden nets.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mdun logs su'ang gdugs rtsibs dang / rtsa ba nor bu dri ma med pa 'od can las byas pa /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mdun logs su'ang gdugs rtsibs dang / rtsa ba nor bu dri ma med pa 'od can las byas pa /
translated: In front of the victory banners, they carry parasols with spokes and bases made of stainless, luminous jewels,

original: mu tig gi chun po dbyangs pa sha stag khyer ro //
analyzed: mu tig gi chun po dbyangs pa sha stag khyer ro //
translated: and they are hung with strings of pearls.

original: gdugs re re'i mdun logs su'ang gser gyi me tog ku mu da dang / autpa la dang / padma dkar po sdong bu beed'urya las byas pa /
analyzed: gdugs re re'i mdun logs su'ang gser gyi me tog ku mu da dang / autpa la dang / padma dkar po sdong bu beed'urya las byas pa /
translated: In front of each parasol, they carry golden flowers of kumuda, utpala, and white lotus, with stems made of beryl.

original: ze ba rdo rje las byas pa /
analyzed: ze ba rdo rje las byas pa /
translated: the stamens made of vajra,

original: bung ba mang po skad 'byin pa /
analyzed: bung ba mang po skad 'byin pa /
translated: with many bees humming,

original: dri bsung zhim po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dri bsung zhim po dang ldan pa /
translated: fragrant with sweet scents,

original: yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba /
translated: pleasing,

original: 'od dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'od dang ldan pa /
translated: radiant,

original: che ba / mang ba sha stag dang / lda ldi chen po sha stag khyer ro //
analyzed: che ba / mang ba sha stag dang / lda ldi chen po sha stag khyer ro //

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / brag ca dang / zla ba'i gzugs brnyan ltar slu bar byed pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / brag ca dang / zla ba'i gzugs brnyan ltar slu bar byed pa /
translated: They are deceptive, like an illusion, a mirage, an echo, or a reflection of the moon in water.

original: rlung shugs drag pos rnam par dkrugs pa'i chu'i shugs kyis brkos pa'i 'gram gyi sdong po ltar g-yang sa na 'dug pa'i chos can /
analyzed: rlung shugs drag pos rnam par dkrugs pa'i chu'i shugs kyis brkos pa'i 'gram gyi sdong po ltar g-yang sa na 'dug pa'i chos can /
translated: They are like a tree on the bank of a river, which is being carried away by the force of the water churned up by a strong wind.

original: spyang ki dang / wa @10b dang / bya rgod dang / bya rog rnams kyi zas yin na /
analyzed: spyang ki dang / wa @10b dang / bya rgod dang / bya rog rnams kyi zas yin na /
translated: They are the food of wolves, foxes, vultures, and crows.

original: su zhig 'di lta bu 'chang ba la dga' bar byad /
analyzed: su zhig 'di lta bu 'chang ba la dga' bar byad /
translated: Who would delight in such a thing?

original: rgya mtsho'i chu thams cad skra'i rtse mos blangs te ba lang gi mig rjes su blugs par ni /🔽nus srid kyi; lus nad bzhi brgya rtsa gzhis gzir ba 'di snying po med pa'am mi gtsang ba ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu thams cad skra'i rtse mos blangs te ba lang gi mig rjes su blugs par ni / nus srid kyi; lus nad bzhi brgya rtsa gzhis gzir ba 'di snying po med pa'am mi gtsang ba ni /
translated: It is possible to take all the water in the ocean with the tip of a hair and pour it into the hoofprint of an ox,

original: tshig tsam gyis bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis bstan par mi nus so //
translated: but it is not possible to demonstrate with mere words the lack of essence or impurity of this body, which is afflicted by the four hundred and four diseases.

original: sa chen po 'di rgya shug gi 'bras bu'i rus pa'i 'bru tsam sha stag tu byas pa'am /
analyzed: sa chen po 'di rgya shug gi 'bras bu'i rus pa'i 'bru tsam sha stag tu byas pa'am /
translated: This great earth is made entirely of sesame seeds the size of juniper berries,

original: yungs 'bru tsam mam /
analyzed: yungs 'bru tsam mam /
translated: or of mustard seeds,

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdul tsam sha stag tu byas pas ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdul tsam sha stag tu byas pas ni /
translated: If I were to reduce it to particles the size of atoms,

original: zad par 'gyur yang srid kyi /
analyzed: zad par 'gyur yang srid kyi /
translated: it would eventually be exhausted.

original: lus 'di yod kyi bar du 'di'i nyes dmigs ni /
analyzed: lus 'di yod kyi bar du 'di'i nyes dmigs ni /
translated: But as long as this body exists,

original: mthar thug par mi 'gyur te; de bas na dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir 'di mchil ma bzhin du dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par mi 'gyur te; de bas na dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir 'di mchil ma bzhin du dor bar bya'o //
translated: its problems will never come to an end. Therefore, in order to protect the holy Dharma, I will cast it aside like a gob of spit.

original: snyam ste / 'di ltar dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad chen po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgoms pas sems bsgoms pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: snyam ste / 'di ltar dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad chen po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgoms pas sems bsgoms pa sha stag ste /
translated: In this way, all those laywomen had cultivated the mind by meditating on the emptiness of the great, the absence of attributes, and the absence of aspiration.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:

original: dge bsnyen ma 'tsho ba'i dpal zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen ma dpal phreng zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen ma sa ga zhes bya ba dang / de la sogs pa thams cad kyang theg pa chen po thos par 'dod la /🔽thos nas kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma 'tsho ba'i dpal zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen ma dpal phreng zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen ma sa ga zhes bya ba dang / de la sogs pa thams cad kyang theg pa chen po thos par 'dod la / thos nas kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
translated: the laywoman Śrījvalati, the laywoman Śrīmālā, the laywoman Viśākhā, and so forth. All of them desired to hear the Mahāyāna.

original: snyam du dam bcas pa /
analyzed: snyam du dam bcas pa /
translated: Having heard it, they made the promise to teach it to others.

original: srung ba lhur len pa /
analyzed: srung ba lhur len pa /
translated: They were dedicated to protecting it.

original: bud med kyi lus ngan no //
analyzed: bud med kyi lus ngan no //
translated: They were disgusted with the female body,

original: snyam du smod pa dang / lus snying po med do //
analyzed: snyam du smod pa dang / lus snying po med do //
translated: thinking, “The body is worthless!”

original: snyam du smod pa so so nas shas cher sgom pa dang / 'khor ba'i 'khor lo gzhig go //
analyzed: snyam du smod pa so so nas shas cher sgom pa dang / 'khor ba'i 'khor lo gzhig go //
translated: They were intent on destroying the wheel of cyclic existence,🔽and they were intent on satisfying the thirst of others

original: snyam du sems pa sha stag dang / theg pa chen pos sko ma la ngoms nas kyang gzhan @11a *//🔽skom pa dag ngom par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam du sems pa sha stag dang / theg pa chen pos sko ma la ngoms nas kyang gzhan @11a *// skom pa dag ngom par bya'o //
translated: with the great vehicle.

original: snyam du dam bcas pa sha stag dang / theg pa chen po la sred pa /
analyzed: snyam du dam bcas pa sha stag dang / theg pa chen po la sred pa /
translated: They were intent on the great vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po la ser sna med pa /🔽'jig rten thams cad dang mthun par slob par 'dod pa dang / grol nas gzhan dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ser sna med pa / 'jig rten thams cad dang mthun par slob par 'dod pa dang / grol nas gzhan dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: they were not stingy with the great vehicle,🔽and they were intent on training in accordance with the whole world.

original: rgal nas gzhan bsgral bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgal nas gzhan bsgral bar bya'o //
translated: They were intent on liberating others after they themselves were liberated,🔽they were intent on liberating others after they themselves were liberated,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par bya'o //
translated: they were intent on not interrupting the lineage of the Three Jewels,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o //
translated: and they were intent on turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: snyam du slob par 'dod pa sha stag dang / go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: snyam du slob par 'dod pa sha stag dang / go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: They were intent on donning the great armor,

original: bslab pa rnams la brtul zhugs brtan pa dang / de bzhin du yon tan du ma dang ldan pa dang / bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams la brtul zhugs brtan pa dang / de bzhin du yon tan du ma dang ldan pa dang / bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan pa sha stag ste /
translated: They were all steadfast in their training, and likewise endowed with many good qualities, and they all had compassion for all sentient beings, as if they were their only child.

original: de dag kyang nyi ma 'char kar shin tu rigs par gcig la gcig 'jus te /
analyzed: de dag kyang nyi ma 'char kar shin tu rigs par gcig la gcig 'jus te /
translated: When the sun rose, they all held each other in high regard.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i phyir yam bsreg shing dge bsnyen pa rnams kyi nyis 'gyur khyer ba las bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal zas ma bzhes nas bu shi ba bzhin du mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te; ngus nas langs te phyogs gcig tu
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i phyir yam bsreg shing dge bsnyen pa rnams kyi nyis 'gyur khyer ba las bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal zas ma bzhes nas bu shi ba bzhin du mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te; ngus nas langs te phyogs gcig tu
translated: In order to cremate the Tathāgata’s body, they brought twice as much firewood as the laymen had brought. But when the Blessed One’s food was not accepted, they were extremely distressed, as if their child had died. They cried, stood up, and went to one side.

original: 'khod do // gzhan yang de'i tshe li tsa ba'i gzhon nu gtsang ma dri ma med pa'i snying po la sogs pa yangs pa can na gnas pa'i li tsa b'i gzhon nu grong khyer gyi nang na gnas pa dang / phyi rol na gnas pa dang bcas pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'khod do // gzhan yang de'i tshe li tsa ba'i gzhon nu gtsang ma dri ma med pa'i snying po la sogs pa yangs pa can na gnas pa'i li tsa b'i gzhon nu grong khyer gyi nang na gnas pa dang / phyi rol na gnas pa dang bcas pa rnams dang /
translated: together with those residing in the city and outside the city,

original: dzambu'i gling na gnas pa'i rgyal phran blon po dang bcas pa gang+g'a'i klung bzhi'i bye ma snyed thams cad kyang dam @11b pa'i chos srung ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na gnas pa'i rgyal phran blon po dang bcas pa gang+g'a'i klung bzhi'i bye ma snyed thams cad kyang dam @11b pa'i chos srung ba la mkhas pa /
translated: and all the minor kings residing in Jambudvīpa, together with their ministers, as numerous as the sands of four Ganges Rivers, all of them skilled in protecting the sublime Dharma,

original: tshul khrims dang cho ga dang yon tan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang cho ga dang yon tan dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with discipline, ritual, and qualities,🔽like hail for those who slander the sublime Dharma and are corrupt in their symbols,

original: dam pa'i chos sun 'byin cing rtags can 'chal pa rnams kyi ser ba lta bur gyur pa sha stag la de dag thams cad kyang 'di lta bur 'dod de /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sun 'byin cing rtags can 'chal pa rnams kyi ser ba lta bur gyur pa sha stag la de dag thams cad kyang 'di lta bur 'dod de /
translated: all of them had this desire:

original: bdag cag gi nor dang / 'bru'i tshogs dang / mdzod dang / pang ba'i tshogs gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: bdag cag gi nor dang / 'bru'i tshogs dang / mdzod dang / pang ba'i tshogs gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: All of our wealth, our collections of grain, our treasuries, and our storehouses,

original: bdud rtsi mi zad par bya ba dang / bdud rtsi gnas par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: bdud rtsi mi zad par bya ba dang / bdud rtsi gnas par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: in order to make the nectar inexhaustible and to make the nectar remain.

original: bdag cag gis dam pa'i chos la nan tan bya'o //🔽dam pa'i chos la sun 'byin cing log bar lta ba rnams kyi lce gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis dam pa'i chos la nan tan bya'o // dam pa'i chos la sun 'byin cing log bar lta ba rnams kyi lce gcad par bya'o //
translated: We should practice the true Dharma.🔽We should cut out the tongues of those who slander the true Dharma and hold wrong views.”

original: zhes legs par dam bcas pa; tshul khrims 'chal pa /
analyzed: zhes legs par dam bcas pa; tshul khrims 'chal pa /
translated: “We should make those who are immoral

original: tshul khrims la mi gnas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims la mi gnas pa rnams ni /
translated: and do not keep the moral precepts

original: gos dkar po gyon du bcug ste /
analyzed: gos dkar po gyon du bcug ste /
translated: wear white clothes

original: khyim pa'i las byed du gzhug go /🔽snyam du sems brtul ba /🔽dam pa'i chos sdug pa la ni; bla ma bzhin du rim gro bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i las byed du gzhug go / snyam du sems brtul ba / dam pa'i chos sdug pa la ni; bla ma bzhin du rim gro bya'o //
translated: and make them do the work of householders.”🔽“We should serve the one who is dear to the true Dharma

original: snyam du dam bcas pa /
analyzed: snyam du dam bcas pa /
translated: as we would a teacher.”🔽“We should complete the benefit and happiness of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun la phan pa dang bde bar gnas par bya ba'i yongs su rdzogs par byas kyang des chog go /
analyzed: dge 'dun la phan pa dang bde bar gnas par bya ba'i yongs su rdzogs par byas kyang des chog go /
translated: That is enough.”

original: snyam du sems pa dang / theg pa chen po thos par 'dod la thos nas kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam du sems pa dang / theg pa chen po thos par 'dod la thos nas kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
translated: “We should listen to the Mahāyāna and, having listened, we should teach it to others.”

original: snyam du yi dam bcas pa la brtan pa dang / de la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: snyam du yi dam bcas pa la brtan pa dang / de la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa sha stag ste /
translated: They were all endowed with such qualities and more.

original: 'di lta ste li tsa b'i gzhon nu gtsang ma dri ma med pa'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / sgrib pa dag pa zhes bya ba dang / gangg'a'i chu dri ma med pas byin pa zhes bya ba dang / de la sogs pa li tsa b'i gzhon nu de dag kyang @12a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste li tsa b'i gzhon nu gtsang ma dri ma med pa'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / sgrib pa dag pa zhes bya ba dang / gangg'a'i chu dri ma med pas byin pa zhes bya ba dang / de la sogs pa li tsa b'i gzhon nu de dag kyang @12a *//
translated: They were the Licchavi youth Pure Stainless Essence, the Licchavi youth Pure of Obstructions, the Licchavi youth Gift of the Pure Water of the Ganges, and so forth.

original: gcig la gcig 'jus te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'jus te /
translated: They all held each other’s hands

original: re res kyang gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i bud shing thang shing gi mchog dang / tsandan dang / aa ga ru rnams dang / yam bsreg shing bye ba phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang / mchod pa snga ma'i nyis 'gyur rnams khyer nas mchod pa rnams bsgrags te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du dong ngo //
analyzed: re res kyang gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i bud shing thang shing gi mchog dang / tsandan dang / aa ga ru rnams dang / yam bsreg shing bye ba phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang / mchod pa snga ma'i nyis 'gyur rnams khyer nas mchod pa rnams bsgrags te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du dong ngo //
translated: and each brought eighty-four quintillion logs of the best sandalwood, agarwood, and juniper trees, as well as twice as many offerings as before. They went to the Blessed One, proclaiming their offerings.

original: li tsa b'i gzhon nu re re zhing yang glang po che brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / rta brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / shing rta brgyad khri bzhi stong dang chas so //
analyzed: li tsa b'i gzhon nu re re zhing yang glang po che brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / rta brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / shing rta brgyad khri bzhi stong dang chas so //
translated: Each Licchavi youth was accompanied by eighty-four thousand elephants, eighty-four thousand horses, and eighty-four thousand chariots.

original: nor bu chu shel brgyad khri bzhi stong dang chas so //
analyzed: nor bu chu shel brgyad khri bzhi stong dang chas so //
translated: They were accompanied by eighty-four thousand crystal jewels.

original: glang po che re re'i mdun du'ang che ba la 'os pa'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dar gyi bla re chen po rnams thogs so //
analyzed: glang po che re re'i mdun du'ang che ba la 'os pa'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dar gyi bla re chen po rnams thogs so //
translated: In front of each elephant were held parasols, victory banners, flags, and great silk canopies suitable for the great.

original: gdugs rnams kyi nang na thung du gang yin pa de la'ang kho ra khor yug tu dpag tshad gcig yod do; ;dar gyi bla re chen po rnams kyi nang na chung du gang yin pa de la'ang chu zheng du dpag tshad sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: gdugs rnams kyi nang na thung du gang yin pa de la'ang kho ra khor yug tu dpag tshad gcig yod do; ;dar gyi bla re chen po rnams kyi nang na chung du gang yin pa de la'ang chu zheng du dpag tshad sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
translated: The shortest of the parasols was one yojana in circumference, and the smallest of the great silk canopies was thirty-two yojanas in width and length.

original: rgyal mtshan rnams kyi nang na thung du gang yin pa de la'ang 'phang du dpag tshad brgya yod do //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan rnams kyi nang na thung du gang yin pa de la'ang 'phang du dpag tshad brgya yod do //
translated: The shortest of the victory banners was one hundred yojanas in height.

original: ba dan rnams kyi nang na thung du gang yin pa des kyang dpag tshad stong du phyin no //
analyzed: ba dan rnams kyi nang na thung du gang yin pa des kyang dpag tshad stong du phyin no //
translated: The shortest of the banners extended for one thousand leagues.

original: de ltar de dag mchod pa rnams dang bcas te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du dong nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te zhal zas phul ba las bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag mchod pa rnams dang bcas te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du dong nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te zhal zas phul ba las bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung ste /
translated: Thus, together with their offerings, they went into the presence of the Bhagavān, bowed their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet, and offered him food. The Bhagavān did not accept it,

original: ma bzhes nas mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te /
analyzed: ma bzhes nas mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te /
translated: and they became extremely distressed.

original: @12b re thag chad nas langs te bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus ta la bdun gyi srid tsam du 'phags te 'khod do //
analyzed: @12b re thag chad nas langs te bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus ta la bdun gyi srid tsam du 'phags te 'khod do //
translated: In despair, they rose up, and through the power of the Bhagavān they rose up to the height of seven tāla trees and remained there.

original: gzhan yang de'i tshe dzambu gling pa'i blon po dang / tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag gangg'a lnga'i bye ma snyed thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la dad pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i tshe dzambu gling pa'i blon po dang / tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag gangg'a lnga'i bye ma snyed thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la dad pa /
translated: At that time, there were ministers, merchants, and householders of Jambudvīpa, as numerous as the sands of five Ganges Rivers, all of whom had faith in the Mahāyāna,

original: tshul khrims dang cho ga dang yon tan rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang cho ga dang yon tan rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa /
translated: were endowed with pure discipline, conduct, and qualities,

original: dam pa'i chos sun 'byin pa rnams kyi ser ba lta bur gyur pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sun 'byin pa rnams kyi ser ba lta bur gyur pa sha stag ste /
translated: They were like hailstorms for those who reviled the holy Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:

original: khyim bdag gi rgyal po rnam par snang byed ces bya ba dang / 'gro ba skyong zhes bya ba dang / chos skyong zhes bya ba dang / de la sogs pa dag kyang de'i tshe der lhags te /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rgyal po rnam par snang byed ces bya ba dang / 'gro ba skyong zhes bya ba dang / chos skyong zhes bya ba dang / de la sogs pa dag kyang de'i tshe der lhags te /
translated: the king of householders called Vairocana, the protector of beings called Dharmapala, and so forth.

original: de dag thams cad kyis kyang rang rang gi mchod pas mchod pa snga ma rnams zil gyis mnan nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa chen po'i tshogs kyis mchod nas zhal zas ma bzhes pa'i phyir mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis kyang rang rang gi mchod pas mchod pa snga ma rnams zil gyis mnan nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa chen po'i tshogs kyis mchod nas zhal zas ma bzhes pa'i phyir mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te /
translated: All of them, having outshone the previous offerings with their own offerings, made a great assembly of offerings to the Bhagavat. Because he did not accept the food, they became extremely sad.

original: re thag chad nas langs te bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus ta la bdun gyi srid tsam du 'phags te 'khod do //
analyzed: re thag chad nas langs te bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus ta la bdun gyi srid tsam du 'phags te 'khod do //
translated: They stood up, their hopes dashed. By the power of the Bhagavat, they rose up to the height of seven palm trees and sat there.

original: gzhan yang de'i tshe rgyal po ma skyes dgra ma gtogs par yangs pa can gyi rgyal po zla ba dri ma med pa'i snying po grong khyer gyi nang na gnas pa dang / phyi rol na gnas pa'i g-yog 'khor dang bcas pa la sogs pa dzambu gling thams cad kyi grong khyer dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i tshe rgyal po ma skyes dgra ma gtogs par yangs pa can gyi rgyal po zla ba dri ma med pa'i snying po grong khyer gyi nang na gnas pa dang / phyi rol na gnas pa'i g-yog 'khor dang bcas pa la sogs pa dzambu gling thams cad kyi grong khyer dang /
translated: Moreover, at that time, except for King Ajātaśatru, all the kings of Vaiśālī, such as King Candravimalamaṇiprabha, who lived in the city and those who lived outside, together with their retinues, and so on, all the kings of the cities,

original: ri khrod kyi grong dang / yul po che dang / kha lungs kyi rgyal po gangg'a'i klung drug gi bye ma snyed dang lhan cig tu dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang bcas te lhags so //🔽rgyal po de rnams re re la'ang dmag 'khrugs ya @13a *//
analyzed: ri khrod kyi grong dang / yul po che dang / kha lungs kyi rgyal po gangg'a'i klung drug gi bye ma snyed dang lhan cig tu dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang bcas te lhags so // rgyal po de rnams re re la'ang dmag 'khrugs ya @13a *//
translated: villages, and large countries of the entire Jambudvīpa, and the kings of the riverine regions as numerous as the sands of six Ganges Rivers, together with their four-division armies, arrived.

original: phrag bco brgyad bco brgyad yod do //

original: 'brug sgra dal nas sgrog pa'i sprin dang ldan pas char zim bu bsil ba dang 'dres pa'i me tog gi char 'bebs shing /🔽bcom ldan 'das la phyag btsal te zhal zas ma bzhes nas re thag chad de /

translated: Moreover, at that time, as many gods as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River who bring rain, along with the cranes who follow them, let fall a rain of flowers mixed with cool, gentle, misty rain from the midst of the great clouds and lightning, with the colors of a peacock's neck.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i me gsad pa'i phyir nam mkha' nyid la 'khod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung zhugs la bzhen pa'i me gsad pa'i phyir nam mkha' nyid la 'khod do //
translated: They were accompanied by clouds that thundered slowly and, after bowing to the Bhagavān, they despaired of being able to offer food and settled in the sky itself in order to extinguish the fire that was burning the Tathāgata's funeral pyre.

analyzed: gzhan yang de'i tshe spos kyi glang po sgra gcan dang / lung tang mdog dang / @18b sbrang rtsi mdog sel dang / 'dod rgu'i spos ldan la sogs pa spos kyi glang po gang+g'a'i klung nyi shu'i bye ma snyed theg pa chen po 'dod pa sha stag gis ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir gangs kyi sman dang /
translated: Furthermore, at that time, there were as many great incense elephants as there are grains of sand in twenty Ganges Rivers, such as the incense elephants Great Incense, Rāhu, Mango Color, Honey Color, and Desirable Incense, who desired the Mahāyāna, and they were all there for the Teacher’s parinirvāṇa.

original: padma'i rtsa ba dang / sdong bu shing rta chen po'i 'phang lo tsam sha stag dang / dgon pa chen po dag nas padma dang / autpa la dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang /

translated: They brought snow medicine, lotus roots, and lotus stalks the size of the wheels of great chariots, and from the great wildernesses they brought lotuses, utpala flowers, kumuta flowers, and white lotuses, roots, fruits,

analyzed: rdo gu sna tha dad pa du ma dag sna'i thor tos byung zhing phung zhing khyer te rlung gi shugs pas kyang ches mgyogs pa dang / shin tu rings par dbyar gyi 'brug sgra bzhin du sgrog cing lhags nas padma'i 'dab ma bcer ba'i sengge'i khri lda ldi dag bshams te bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas zhal zas ma bzhes nas re thag chad de phyogs gcig tu 'khod do // gzhan yang de'i tshe sedge sedge'i sgra sgrog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sedge gadg'a'i gklung sum cu'i bye ma snyed sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa sha stag gis sedge'i rtsal chen pos spos kyi glang po che rnams dang 'dra bar me tog
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, who are very powerful, with various kinds of flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, cloths, parasols, banners, pennants, music, eulogies, and so forth, with many hundreds of thousands of musical performances, and with many hundreds of thousands of eulogies, having made offerings to the Bhagavat, and not having received any food, were disappointed and sat to one side.

translated: Moreover, other great birds such as geese, cranes, ducks, wild geese, peacocks, cuckoos, parrots, kalaviṅka birds, and pheasants, carrying flowers and fruits like the elephants of incense, arrived and settled in one place, each emitting their own sounds.

original: phye ma dang / ba tshvas ma 'bags shing tsha ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba med pa dag gzigs te /
analyzed: phye ma dang / ba tshvas ma 'bags shing tsha ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba med pa dag gzigs te /
translated: At that time, all the cows, buffaloes, and nanny goats on the ground filled their udders with milk and arrived very quickly. They saw a valley in front of the pair of sāla trees and there, from their udders filled with milk, they let out milk that was not mixed with chaff, dust, or salt, and was free from the fault of being hot.🔽The Blessed One saw this.

analyzed: 'o ma de dag gi nang nas sbrang bu dag bsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //

translated: At that time, there were also sages such as Kṣāntivāda, who dwelled in the four continents, possessed the five supernormal knowledges, and desired the Great Vehicle. As numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, each by their own supernormal powers🔽brought firewood and food offerings,

translated: prostrated to the Blessed One, and sat to one side.

translated: At that time, except for some of the saṅgha of monks such as Mahākāśyapa and the elder Ānanda, all the monks and nuns who dwelled in the various regions also arrived there without exception.

translated: At that time, the great mountains such as Mount Meru, and the mountains in the spaces between worlds, as numerous as the grains of sand in countless Ganges Rivers, with their many trees and vines, providing shade day and night,

analyzed: bdag sbrang bu dang 'dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bgyid pa'i rngo ga la thogs kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhal zas kyi tha ma gsol bar ci gnang zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du gsol ba btab kyang lan gnyis
translated: Since I am like a fly, how could I possibly make offerings to the Bhagavān? However, Bhagavān, out of compassion for me, please accept this last meal.”

analyzed: lan gsum du bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur te /

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te /

original: des sras kyi thu bo nyan thos lus chen mtha' yas la bka' stsal pa /🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: des sras kyi thu bo nyan thos lus chen mtha' yas la bka' stsal pa / rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: khyod kyi the tshom dang / yid gnyis ci dang ci yod pa de dang / de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de kho na la legs par zhus shig dang / des khyod la lung ston par 'gyur ro //

original: zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal to //

translated: are so great that

analyzed: ba gam thams cad kyi bar bar na'ang shing ljon pa gzhon sha can 'bras bu dang / me tog dang ldan pa sna mang po dag yod do //
translated: Between all the balconies, there were many young trees with fruits and flowers.

original: snyam du dga' ba skyed cig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs su gsol zhes de skad du khyod gsol ba ma 'debs shig /
analyzed: snyam du dga' ba skyed cig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs su gsol zhes de skad du khyod gsol ba ma 'debs shig /
translated: Do not request the Tathāgata, saying, ‘Bhagavān, please remain.’

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi de kho na nyid la rtogs shig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi de kho na nyid la rtogs shig /
translated: Understand the reality of the Dharma of the buddhas.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la 'jug par gyis shig /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la 'jug par gyis shig /
translated: Enter into impermanence.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin shes par gyis shig /
translated: Understand the nature of conditioned things.”

original: ces bka' stsal nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bka' stsal nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Having said this, he spoke these verses:

original: tshe ni shin tu ring yang 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe ni shin tu ring yang 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: Even if one’s life is long, it will end in death.🔽Here, everyone is certain to die;

original: 'dir ni thams cad nges par 'chi bar 'gyur; ;'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: 'dir ni thams cad nges par 'chi bar 'gyur; ;'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: The world of the living is subject to destruction.

original: 'byor pa thams cad rgud par gzhol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor pa thams cad rgud par gzhol bar 'gyur //
translated: All prosperity ends in decline.

original: rtag tu lang tsho rga bas nges par 'joms //
analyzed: rtag tu lang tsho rga bas nges par 'joms //
translated: Youth is always destroyed by old age.

original: gzugs bzang nad med nad kyis 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzugs bzang nad med nad kyis 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: Good health is destroyed by illness.

original: srog ni 'chi bas rtsa nas 'byin par byed //
analyzed: srog ni 'chi bas rtsa nas 'byin par byed //
translated: Life is taken away by death.

original: 'jig rten kun na rtag pa ci yang med //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun na rtag pa ci yang med //
translated: Nothing in the world is permanent.

original: dbang phyug mi rtag tshe yang mi rtag ste //
analyzed: dbang phyug mi rtag tshe yang mi rtag ste //
translated: Even the impermanent lord of life

original: skye bo sdug bsngal 'khor lo rtag tu 'khor //
analyzed: skye bo sdug bsngal 'khor lo rtag tu 'khor //
translated: Keeps the wheel of suffering beings always turning.

original: 'jig @32a *// rten gsum na brtan po ci yang med //
analyzed: 'jig @32a *// rten gsum na brtan po ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing stable in the three worlds.

original: srid pa dag na 'gro kun srog tu 'dug /
analyzed: srid pa dag na 'gro kun srog tu 'dug /
translated: All beings in existence are subject to death.

original: srid pa 'jig pa'i chos can rab g-yo ba //
analyzed: srid pa 'jig pa'i chos can rab g-yo ba //
translated: Existence is subject to destruction and is very unstable.

original: 'di dag na ni bde ba ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di dag na ni bde ba ci yang med //
translated: There is no happiness at all in this world.

original: rga dang 'chi dang nad dang rgud rnams kyi //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi dang nad dang rgud rnams kyi //
translated: The fear of old age, death, illness, and decline

original: 'jigs pas rtag tu kun nas gtse bar byed //
analyzed: 'jigs pas rtag tu kun nas gtse bar byed //
translated: Always torments everyone.

original: srid pa mtha' med mi brtan snying po med //
analyzed: srid pa mtha' med mi brtan snying po med //
translated: Existence is endless, unstable, and without essence.

original: thams cad dgra dang 'khu bar shes par gyis //🔽de na 'khor zhing nyon mongs dra ba yis //
analyzed: thams cad dgra dang 'khu bar shes par gyis // de na 'khor zhing nyon mongs dra ba yis //
translated: Know that everything is an enemy and a foe.🔽Wandering there, the world is entangled

original: 'jig rten dkris te dar gyi srin bu bzhin //
analyzed: 'jig rten dkris te dar gyi srin bu bzhin //
translated: in the net of afflictions, like a silkworm in a cocoon.

original: 'jig rten dag na ther zug gnod pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na ther zug gnod pa'i gzhi //
translated: In the world, the basis of constant suffering,

original: rtag tu 'bras ltar sdug bsngal 'brel ba gang //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bras ltar sdug bsngal 'brel ba gang //
translated: like a rice grain, is always connected with suffering.

original: mi gtsang lus dang 'dod pa de dag la //
analyzed: mi gtsang lus dang 'dod pa de dag la //
translated: Who would delight in this impure body and in desires,

original: phan 'dod sdug bsngal bsal 'dod su zhig dga'//
analyzed: phan 'dod sdug bsngal bsal 'dod su zhig dga'//
translated: wanting to benefit and wishing to remove suffering?

original: mi rtag 'dod pa rnams la chags pa med //🔽tshul bzhin rtog pas 'dod chags 'bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag 'dod pa rnams la chags pa med // tshul bzhin rtog pas 'dod chags 'bral bar 'gyur //
translated: There is no attachment to impermanent desires.🔽Through proper investigation, one becomes free from attachment.

original: de nas yang dag mthong na 'dod chags 'bral //
analyzed: de nas yang dag mthong na 'dod chags 'bral //
translated: Then, seeing reality, one becomes free from attachment.

original: de dag spangs bcad grol pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag spangs bcad grol pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Abandoning and cutting that, one becomes liberated.

original: da ni srid pa'i chu chen legs par rgal //
analyzed: da ni srid pa'i chu chen legs par rgal //
translated: Now I have well crossed the great river of existence.

original: nga ni sdug bsngal rnams 'das bde bar zhugs //
analyzed: nga ni sdug bsngal rnams 'das bde bar zhugs //
translated: I have gone beyond suffering and entered bliss.

original: de phyir ngas ni mtha' yas spros med pa //
analyzed: de phyir ngas ni mtha' yas spros med pa //
translated: Therefore, I have attained the infinite, free from elaborations.

original: chags pa kun bsal thar pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa kun bsal thar pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: And be free from all attachment.

original: nga la rga dang na dang 'chi ba med //
analyzed: nga la rga dang na dang 'chi ba med //
translated: I am not subject to old age, sickness, or death.

original: nga la rtag tu tshe yang zad pa med //
analyzed: nga la rtag tu tshe yang zad pa med //
translated: My life span is never exhausted.

original: nga ni me ltar 'bar te 'gro 'gyur gyis //
analyzed: nga ni me ltar 'bar te 'gro 'gyur gyis //
translated: I will go forth blazing like a fire.

original: khyod kyis nga ni med 'gyur ma sems shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis nga ni med 'gyur ma sems shig /
translated: Do not think that I will disappear.

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid lhun po 'dra bar ltos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid lhun po 'dra bar ltos //
translated: See the Thus-Gone One as being like Mount Meru.

original: nga deng yang dag mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nga deng yang dag mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: I will now attain perfect nirvana.

original: bde mchog de ni nga yi chos nyid de //
analyzed: bde mchog de ni nga yi chos nyid de //
translated: That is my supreme bliss,

original: rgyal rnams spyod yul yin gyi @32b khyed ma ngu //
analyzed: rgyal rnams spyod yul yin gyi @32b khyed ma ngu //
translated: The domain of the victors—do not weep.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la mgar ba'i bu skul byed kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la mgar ba'i bu skul byed kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Kapila, the son of a smith, said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de ni / de lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de ni / de lags so //
translated: “Blessed One,🔽that is so,

original: de ni / de lags te /
analyzed: de ni / de lags te /
translated: that is so.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: Nirvana

original: bdag gis kyang bsam gyis mi khyab lags na /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang bsam gyis mi khyab lags na /
translated: is inconceivable to me,

original: sbrang bu dang 'dra ba'i sems can theg pa dman pa gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
analyzed: sbrang bu dang 'dra ba'i sems can theg pa dman pa gzhan dag gis lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
translated: let alone to other beings of lesser vehicles who are like insects.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: kye ma bdag deng du byang chub sems dpa' mi mchog skal ba chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kye ma bdag deng du byang chub sems dpa' mi mchog skal ba chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: “Ah! Today I have become equal to the bodhisattvas, the supreme humans, those endowed with great fortune,

original: mchod par 'os pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sogs pa dang / zag pa zad pa rnams dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur to //
analyzed: mchod par 'os pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sogs pa dang / zag pa zad pa rnams dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur to //
translated: those worthy of worship, such as the youthful Mañjuśrī, and those who have exhausted defilements.”

original: bcom ldan 'das; dper gsol na /🔽gsar du bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhon nu'ang rab tu byung ba de nyid kyi nyin par nas dge 'dun gyi nang na dge 'dun gyi nang na dge 'dun du bgrang zhing yang dag par 'dus par 'gyur ba de bzhin du bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus byang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; dper gsol na / gsar du bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhon nu'ang rab tu byung ba de nyid kyi nyin par nas dge 'dun gyi nang na dge 'dun gyi nang na dge 'dun du bgrang zhing yang dag par 'dus par 'gyur ba de bzhin du bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus byang
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:🔽Just as a newly ordained young monk, on the very day of his ordination, is counted among the saṅgha and is truly included in the saṅgha,

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi grangs su gtogs shing yang dag par 'dus lags so //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi grangs su gtogs shing yang dag par 'dus lags so //
translated: in the same way, through the power of the Tathāgata, I am counted among the bodhisattva mahāsattvas and am truly included among them.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag ni / de bzhin gshegs pa yun du bzhugs par 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / de bzhin gshegs pa yun du bzhugs par 'tshal gyi /
translated: I wish for the Tathāgata to remain for a long time.

original: kha zas tshig pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs par ni /
analyzed: kha zas tshig pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs par ni /
translated: Do not pass into nirvāṇa like food that has been burned.

original: mi 'tshal lags so //
analyzed: mi 'tshal lags so //
translated: “No, I do not.”

original: de nas de'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mgar ba'i bu skul byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mgar ba'i bu skul byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then at that time Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said this to the smith’s son Cunda:

original: skul byed / khyod 'di skad du bdag ni /
analyzed: skul byed / khyod 'di skad du bdag ni /
translated: “Cunda, do not say this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yun du bzhugs par 'tshal gyi //🔽kha zas tshig pa bzhin @33a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yun du bzhugs par 'tshal gyi // kha zas tshig pa bzhin @33a *//
translated: ‘I want the Tathāgata to live long🔽and not go to final nirvāṇa,

original: du mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs par ni mi 'chal lo //
analyzed: du mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs par ni mi 'chal lo //
translated: like food that has been poisoned.🔽’

original: zhes de skad ma zer cig /
analyzed: zhes de skad ma zer cig /
translated: Do not say that.

original: 'du byed kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya mod /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya mod /
translated: The nature of compounded things should be seen.

original: de ltar lta ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Whoever sees in that way

original: stong pa nyid sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: will complete the meditation on emptiness.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dod pas na de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dod pas na de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire the good Dharma should train in that way.”

original: skul byed kyis smras pa /
analyzed: skul byed kyis smras pa /
translated: Cunda said,

original: btsun pa 'jam dpal /
analyzed: btsun pa 'jam dpal /
translated: “Venerable Mañjuśrī,

original: 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lha'i yang lha mchog tu gyur pa la gal te 'du byed du gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lha'i yang lha mchog tu gyur pa la gal te 'du byed du gyur na /
translated: if the Tathāgata, the supreme god of gods, were to become a compounded thing,

original: lha'i yang lhar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i yang lhar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: he would not be worthy of being the god of gods.

original: 'du byed rnams ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni /
translated: Compounded things

original: chu bur bzhin du shes shing shing rta'i 'phang lo bzhin du 'khor ba yin no; ;lha rnams ni /
analyzed: chu bur bzhin du shes shing shing rta'i 'phang lo bzhin du 'khor ba yin no; ;lha rnams ni /
translated: They are like bubbles and like a wheel.

original: mchog tu tshe ring zhes grag la /
analyzed: mchog tu tshe ring zhes grag la /
translated: The gods are said to have a very long life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
translated: But the Tathāgata

original: lo brgya'ang ma thub ste /
analyzed: lo brgya'ang ma thub ste /
translated: does not even live a hundred years.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lha'i yang ltar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lha'i yang ltar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata is not worthy of worship even by the gods.

original: dper na / mi la la zhig grong dpon byed pa las de mthar gyis dbang phyug chen por gyur nas blon po chen po'i dbang phyug las kyang 'das te /
analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig grong dpon byed pa las de mthar gyis dbang phyug chen por gyur nas blon po chen po'i dbang phyug las kyang 'das te /
translated: For example, suppose that a certain man, having been a village headman, gradually became a great lord, and having surpassed the lordship of a great minister,

original: rang gi dbang phyug gi 'bras bu chos kyis rnyed pa la longs spyod pa las de phyir yang bsod nams zad cing dbang phyug las nyams par gyur na /
analyzed: rang gi dbang phyug gi 'bras bu chos kyis rnyed pa la longs spyod pa las de phyir yang bsod nams zad cing dbang phyug las nyams par gyur na /
translated: he enjoyed the fruits of his lordship, which he had acquired by righteous means. But later, his merit exhausted, he fell from his lordship,

original: gzhan gyis bkol zhing brnyas par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkol zhing brnyas par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: and was enslaved and despised by others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbul por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbul por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he became poor.

original: de dang 'dra bar gal te de bzhin gshegs pa 'du byed du gyur du zin na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gal te de bzhin gshegs pa 'du byed du gyur du zin na /
translated: In the same way, if the Tathāgata were a product,

original: 'chi ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lha'i yang lhar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lha'i yang lhar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the cause of death, it is not even worthy to be the god of the gods.

original: btsun pa 'jam dpal de bas na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'jam dpal de bas na /
translated: Venerable Mañjuśrī, therefore

original: @33b lha'i yang lha de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la de ltar 'du byed dang 'dra bar ma lta zhig /
analyzed: @33b lha'i yang lha de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la de ltar 'du byed dang 'dra bar ma lta zhig /
translated: do not regard the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the god of gods, in that way, as being like compounded things.

original: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang ci khyod shes bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang ci khyod shes bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, do you knowingly

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'du byed kyi rang bzhin du rtog par byed dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'du byed kyi rang bzhin du rtog par byed dam /
translated: conceive of the Tathāgata as having the nature of compounded things,

original: 'on te ma shes pas rtog par byed /
analyzed: 'on te ma shes pas rtog par byed /
translated: or do you conceive of him out of ignorance?

original: gal te de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa 'du byed dang 'dru na ni /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa 'du byed dang 'dru na ni /
translated: If the Tathāgata were like compounded things in that way,

original: 'jig rten gsum po dag na chos kyi dbang phyug rnyed pa lha'i lha mdzad pa'i 'os ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po dag na chos kyi dbang phyug rnyed pa lha'i lha mdzad pa'i 'os ma yin no //
translated: then the one who has attained lordship over the Dharma in the three worlds, the god of gods, would not be worthy of worship.

original: dper na / rgyal po'i dbang po la la zhig la gyad stong gi mchog tu gyur ba'i gyad cig yod la /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po'i dbang po la la zhig la gyad stong gi mchog tu gyur ba'i gyad cig yod la /
translated: For example, suppose a certain king had a wrestler who was supreme among a thousand wrestlers.

original: de gyad thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i phyir gyad stong thub ces bya ba'i ming thob ste /
analyzed: de gyad thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i phyir gyad stong thub ces bya ba'i ming thob ste /
translated: Because he could not be defeated by any wrestler, he became known as the wrestler who defeats a thousand.

original: de la gyad zla med pa'i phyir bla nas dbang thang chen po 'grub na /
analyzed: de la gyad zla med pa'i phyir bla nas dbang thang chen po 'grub na /
translated: If he had no equal among wrestlers, he would have attained great power.

original: ci gyad stong thub pa de'i ming de thos na skad grags pa de mi bden pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gyad stong thub pa de'i ming de thos na skad grags pa de mi bden pa yin nam /
translated: If you hear that the wrestler who defeats a thousand has such a name, is that name false?

original: 'on te yon tan yod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te yon tan yod na ni /
translated: Or, if he has good qualities,

original: yon tan can gyi ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan can gyi ming thob pa yin no //
translated: he has attained the name of one who has good qualities.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / phung po'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / rang bzhin gyi bdud kyi gyad thams cad bcom pas na; gyad stong thub bzhin du yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas 'jig rten gsum po dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / phung po'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / rang bzhin gyi bdud kyi gyad thams cad bcom pas na; gyad stong thub bzhin du yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas 'jig rten gsum po dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata has defeated all the wrestlers of the māras: the māra of the afflictions, the māra of the aggregates, the māra of the son of the gods, and the māra of the nature of things. Therefore, in the same way as the wrestler who defeats a thousand, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One is called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One in the three worlds through his true good qualities.

original: btsun pa 'jam dpal /
analyzed: btsun pa 'jam dpal /
translated: “Venerable Mañjuśrī,

original: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la 'du byed dang 'dra bar yongs su ma rtog cig /
analyzed: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la 'du byed dang 'dra bar yongs su ma rtog cig /
translated: You should not imagine that the Tathāgata is like a conditioned phenomenon.

original: dper na / la la zhig phyug cing nor mang ba'i rigs su skye ba blangs la tshe thung bar 'gyur ba zhig ste /
analyzed: dper na / la la zhig phyug cing nor mang ba'i rigs su skye ba blangs la tshe thung bar 'gyur ba zhig ste /
translated: For example, suppose someone is born into a family that is wealthy and has many possessions, but that person has a short life span.

original: @34a *// de skar mkhan dag gis mthong nas khye'u 'di ni /🔽tshe thung ngo //
analyzed: @34a *// de skar mkhan dag gis mthong nas khye'u 'di ni / tshe thung ngo //
translated: When astrologers see this, they declare, ‘This child

analyzed: zhes bstan te /
translated: has a short life span.’

original: de'i pha mas de skad thos na /
analyzed: de'i pha mas de skad thos na /
translated: When his parents hear this,

analyzed: 'di ni / bdag cag gi khyim du phan par 'gyur ba ma yin no; ;snyam nas grangs su'ang mi rtsi zhing de la byams par mi byed do //
translated: they think, ‘This is not beneficial for our family,’ and they do not count him among their children and do not love him.

original: de ltar skyes pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa'am /
translated: In the same way, if a man,

original: bud med dam /
analyzed: bud med dam /
translated: a woman,

original: lha'am / tshangs pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: lha'am / tshangs pa'ang rung ste /

original: thub pa bdag cag snying ni stor bar gyur //
analyzed: thub pa bdag cag snying ni stor bar gyur //

original: ba gzhon rkun khyer be'u la chags pa bzhin //
analyzed: ba gzhon rkun khyer be'u la chags pa bzhin //

original: mgon med dbul po'i mi ni la la zhig /
analyzed: mgon med dbul po'i mi ni la la zhig /

analyzed: nad kyis thabs la sman pa med pa dang // rang dgar byed cing kha zas gnod pa rnams //

analyzed: za ba ji ltar 'chi bar 'gyur ba bzhin //

original: skye bo 'di dag nyon mongs nad kyis thabs //
analyzed: skye bo 'di dag nyon mongs nad kyis thabs //

original: khyod med khyod kyi chos kyi gsos med pas //
analyzed: khyod med khyod kyi chos kyi gsos med pas //

original: lta ba'i nyes pa bye 'drar 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa bye 'drar 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: They will die from the faults of their views, like a camel from a broken leg.

original: de bas phan phyir 'jig rten ma dor cig /🔽ji ltar grong khyer rgyal dang bral ba dang // dbul po rnams la mu ge byung ba dang // ji ltar dgon par skom gyis gdungs pa bzhin //
analyzed: de bas phan phyir 'jig rten ma dor cig / ji ltar grong khyer rgyal dang bral ba dang // dbul po rnams la mu ge byung ba dang // ji ltar dgon par skom gyis gdungs pa bzhin //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of benefiting them, do not abandon the world.🔽After you have passed into parinirvāṇa, we will be like a city without a king,🔽like the poor when famine strikes,

original: khyod 'das 'og tu bdag cag de 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod 'das 'og tu bdag cag de 'drar 'gyur //

original: sems can gces khyod mya ngan 'da' bzhed pas //
analyzed: sems can gces khyod mya ngan 'da' bzhed pas //

original: sa gzhi rab tu g-yos shing phyogs kyang tshol //
analyzed: sa gzhi rab tu g-yos shing phyogs kyang tshol //

original: rgya mtsho chen po dag kyang rnam par 'khrugs //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po dag kyang rnam par 'khrugs //

original: bdag cag kun kyang sdug cing bsngal bar gyur //
analyzed: bdag cag kun kyang sdug cing bsngal bar gyur //

original: drang srong chen po deng khyod mya ngan las //
analyzed: drang srong chen po deng khyod mya ngan las //

analyzed: 'das na nyi ma'ang sa la stung yang dag /

original: rgya mtsho chen po dag kyang skam par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po dag kyang skam par 'gyur //

original: bdag cag kun @39b kyang deng du 'gum lags grang //
analyzed: bdag cag kun @39b kyang deng du 'gum lags grang //

original: ji ltar stobs ldan mis ni sgo gseb nas //
analyzed: ji ltar stobs ldan mis ni sgo gseb nas //
translated: “Just as a powerful man,

original: glang chen khyer te nang du 'dzul bgyid na //
analyzed: glang chen khyer te nang du 'dzul bgyid na //

original: shin tu nyon mongs 'gyur ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: shin tu nyon mongs 'gyur ba de bzhin du //
translated: Would become extremely exhausted,

original: bdag cag thams cad rab tu nyon mongs gyur //
analyzed: bdag cag thams cad rab tu nyon mongs gyur //
translated: So all of us are now exhausted.

original: ji ltar bu gcig 'gum par mi 'tshal zhing //
analyzed: ji ltar bu gcig 'gum par mi 'tshal zhing //
translated: “Just as one would not wish for one’s only child to die,

original: mya ngan khyod 'da' bdag cag de mi 'tshal //
analyzed: mya ngan khyod 'da' bdag cag de mi 'tshal //
translated: We do not wish for you to pass into nirvāṇa.

original: gal te khyod ni mya ngan 'da' ba las //
analyzed: gal te khyod ni mya ngan 'da' ba las //
translated: If you do not remain in nirvāṇa,

original: mi gzhes bdag cag thams cad phongs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gzhes bdag cag thams cad phongs par 'gyur //

original: khyod ni mya ngan 'das lam gshegs mthong bas //
analyzed: khyod ni mya ngan 'das lam gshegs mthong bas //
translated: “Seeing you go on the path to nirvāṇa,

analyzed: dud 'gro mang po'ang g-yar ngan cher bgyid na //
translated: Even many animals will be greatly distressed.🔽How could we not be distressed?

original: bdag cag ji ltar g-yar ngan mi 'tshal lags //
analyzed: bdag cag ji ltar g-yar ngan mi 'tshal lags //
translated: How could we not be afraid?🔽

original: bdag cag mchil ma bzhin du ma dor cig /🔽nyi ma 'char kar rang gi 'od gsal bas //
analyzed: bdag cag mchil ma bzhin du ma dor cig / nyi ma 'char kar rang gi 'od gsal bas //
translated: Do not abandon us like a gob of spit!🔽Just as the rising sun🔽shines with its own light

original: mun nag rnam par bcom pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: mun nag rnam par bcom pa de bzhin du //
translated: and destroys the darkness,

original: 'phrul can khyod kyis sdug bsngal mun bsal te //
analyzed: 'phrul can khyod kyis sdug bsngal mun bsal te //
translated: so you, O magician, have dispelled the darkness of suffering

original: dge 'dun dbus su ri rab bzhin du bzhugs //
analyzed: dge 'dun dbus su ri rab bzhin du bzhugs //
translated: and sit in the midst of the Saṅgha like Mount Meru.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dper gsol na /
analyzed: dper gsol na /
translated: please let me give an analogy.

analyzed: rgyal po la la zhig gi bu sdug cing phangs pa zhig mchis la /

original: des de chos lugs kyi bstan bcos bslab nas 'di sod cig /
analyzed: des de chos lugs kyi bstan bcos bslab nas 'di sod cig /
translated: The king would teach him the treatises on statecraft and say, ‘Live like this.’

original: ces bka' stsal pa de bzhin du bdag cag bcom ldan 'das dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sras rnams kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed nas bkum gyis ma mchis na /
analyzed: ces bka' stsal pa de bzhin du bdag cag bcom ldan 'das dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sras rnams kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed nas bkum gyis ma mchis na /
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, we are the sons of the Blessed One, the turner of the wheel of the true Dharma. Having generated the right view, we are not killed.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rgyal po'i bu ji lta ba de bzhin du bdag cag mi 'gum par bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du yun ring du bzhugs su gsol //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu ji lta ba de bzhin du bdag cag mi 'gum par bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du yun ring du bzhugs su gsol //

original: ji ltar la la zhig gzhung gis rtsod pa'i @40a *//
analyzed: ji ltar la la zhig gzhung gis rtsod pa'i @40a *//

analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pa na skrag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyod kyis skrag par ma mdzad cig /

analyzed: de kho na nyid mkhyen bzhin du bdag cag sems can dmyal bar mchi bar ma mdzad cig /
